value.title: Use the Power BI Decomposition Tree to Explore and Analyze Your Data
value.excerpt: The Decomposition Tree is the cool new AI powered Visual in Power BI, that can really help you explore and analyze your data. We will show you step-by-step on how you can use the Decomposition Tree visual and also share some useful tips along the way.  ================================ ðŸ‘‰ FREE Power

value.title: Build Your Own Power BI Audit Log; Usage Metrics Across the Entire Tenant
value.excerpt: Power BI dashboard and reports come with a usage metric, which you can see how users used this content. There is also another usage metrics across the entire tenant, which you can see it if you have access to Power BI Administrator account, under Admin Panel in the Power BI Service. However, what if

value.title: Generate Year and Month Combinations in Power BI Report using DAX
value.excerpt: A common requirement when reporting data with a Date axis is to be able to see the year and the month in a short form beside each other. Formats such as 2021 Jan, or Jan 2021, or even Jan 21, or 2021-01 are very popular. In Power BI, ideally, you should have a Date dimension with columns for this. However,

value.title: Power BI Get Data from Google Sheets
value.excerpt: Power BI can get data from Google Sheet now. This functionality is released just yesterday and announced in both Power BI and Power Query blogs. The feature is still preview (Beta) but it is worthwhile looking at how it works in a quick article and video. Study more from my blog article here:  https://radacad.com/power-bi-get-data-from-google-sheets

value.title: Computing totals by summing visible values in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to compute a measure that sums the values produced row by row in the visual into the visual total, instead of recomputing the total value in the filter context of the total. Article and download: https://sql.bi/89870

value.title: Deep dive into measure filters in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In this video, we perform a deep analysis of the DAX queries generated by Power BI when you use a measure as a filter in a Power BI visual. The DAX code generated might show a different behavior whether the measure is part of the values shown in the visual or not.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/721618?aff=yt

value.title: Introducing RANKX in DAX
value.excerpt: RANKX is a simple function used to rank a value within a list of values. Its use is simple, but it can be a source of frustration for newbies. Article and download: https://sql.bi/760169?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Connect and analyze your Dynamics 365 dataâ€‹
value.excerpt: Connect and analyze your Dynamics 365 Dataâ€‹

value.title: Explore data analytics at scale
value.excerpt: Describe data analytics at scale and understand the roles of a data team. Learn about the responsibilities of an enterprise data analyst and what tools are available to build scalable solutions.

value.title: Introduction to end-to-end analytics using Microsoft Fabric
value.excerpt: Discover how Microsoft Fabric can meet your enterprise's analytics needs in one platform. Discover the capabilities Fabric has to offer, understand how it works, and identify how you can use Fabric for your analytics needs.

value.title: Implement row-level security
value.excerpt: Row-level security (RLS) allows you to create a single or a set of reports that targets data for a specific user. In this module, you will learn how to implement RLS by using either a static or dynamic method and how Microsoft Power BI simplifies testing RLS in Power BI Desktop and Power BI service.

value.title: Work with Delta Lake tables in Microsoft Fabric
value.excerpt: Tables in a Microsoft Fabric lakehouse are based on the Delta Lake technology commonly used in Apache Spark. By using the enhanced capabilities of delta tables, you can create advanced analytics solutions.

value.title: Add colored KPI arrows to Power BI 2019 version
value.excerpt: Do you know how to create colored KPIs in Power BI in 2019? In this video I am going to show you the way I do nowadays. Do you have a better way?
